title: Mr. Tom Turner v. South Florida Presbytery
parties: Mr. Tom Turner v. South Florida Presbytery
source: Case 2023-17: Mr. Tom Turner v. South Florida Presbytery, M51GA, 2024, 184-188
tags: Complaints, Presbytery, Authority of, Church, Dissolution, Due Process, Censure, Abuse, Sexuality
summary:
CASE Nos. 2023 -15 & 2023 -17
MR. TOM TURNER
v.
SOUTH FLORIDA PRESBYTERY
RULING ON COMPLAINTS
March 7, 2024
South Florida Presbytery ruled these Complaints administratively out of order for lack of standing. Likewise, t he SJC  rules these Complaints  are administratively out of order due to lack of standing and cannot be put in order.  Mr. Turner  is no longer a member of the PCA because Cross Community Church, where he is a member, disaffiliated from the PCA at a congregational meeting on February 12, 2023. ... (continues through pages 184-188)
